results.title: Solar oil
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
As Australian oil reserves recede, many scientists are turning to the sun for a solution in the looming energy crisis. In Australia, scientists employed by the Department of Defence have been encouraged by their research in a revolutionary form of oil - solar oil. The oil is obtained from a freshwater green alga (Botryococcus) which has the ability to store hydrocarbons direct from sunlight. Its special properties makes the alga an unusual subject of the plant world, and a possible key to energy alternatives. Photography by Phil Hobson, sound by Ron Townsend and narrated by Roger Newcombe.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations

results.title: Reaching for the rainbow
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Sentinel”.
A twenty-man specialist Australian Army Engineers Unit is helping the Papua New Guinea Government with road-building and major works projects in the remote Southern Highlands Province of central Papua New Guinea. No other credits available.

results.title: Anyone anything anywhere
results.creator_credit: Don Scheldrup, Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Despite its low profile, the transport element of the Royal Australian Airforce is one of the largest air carriers in Australia. It has both national and international commitments and is capable of delivering anyone, or almost anything, anywhere in the world. Narrated by Peter Gwynne. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Challenge of flight
results.creator_credit: Don Scheldrup, Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Shows the tough and rigorous pilot training courses conducted by the Royal Australian Air Force at Point Cook in Victoria and at Pearce in Western Australia. Only fifty per cent of trainees pass the course.

results.title: A Fighting chance
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Max Inglis, a Norfolk Island resident, owes his life to a recent RAAF aeromedical evacuation operation, but he is only one of thousands of Australians whose lives have been saved by this unique service.

results.title: Coastwatch
results.creator_credit: Don Scheldrup, Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Australia has the largest accessible coastline in the world. The first line of defence is the coastwatch. The Fremantle class a fast all weather vessel has been introduced as the new type of patrol boat that will provide security for the nation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Scheldrup, Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations

results.title: Sappers K9: the dogs of war
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Concealed explosives have maimed and killed Australians in military conflict and society because they do not necessarily incorporate metallic components and are undetectable by conventional machines. The use of a special breed of German Shepherd dog by the Royal Australian Engineers promises greater security.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations

results.title: Combating the '79 locust plague
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
In 1979, the biggest locust plague in 25 years threatened pasture and crops valued at hundreds of millions of dollars in New South Wales, Victoria and South Australia. Army and Air Force units helped farmers, graziers, State, Federal and rural authorities to fight the menace.
